node.title: Could re-election as public advocate set Jumaane Williams up for the governor’s race?
node.description: Mr. Williams is expected to win re-election as public advocate even as he openly contemplates a campaign for higher office.

node.title: The Board of Elections has a spotty track record. Officials say today is going more smoothly.
node.description: After embarrassing missteps during June’s primary, the Board of Elections said there had not been major disruptions to voting on Tuesday morning.

node.title: A cryptocurrency inspired by ‘Squid Game’ crashes. The industry has questions.
node.description: The digital money, called Squid, began trading last week for a penny. It soared spectacularly, before the money vanished.

node.title: Is It Possible to Explain How Consciousness Works?
node.description: The neuroscientist Antonio Damasio has distilled his theories about consciousness in “Feeling & Knowing,” paring things down and using an accessible style.

node.title: 9-Year-Old Fatally Stabs 11-Year-Old in Fight Over Nerf Gun
node.description: The two boys were in a "tug-of-war" over the gun when the 9-year-old stabbed the 11-year-old in the chest with a knife the child was holding.

node.title: China Tells U.S. to Be Transparent, Take 'Responsibility' for Accident in South China Sea
node.description: China is calling for the U.S. to take responsibility for an accident involving a nuclear-powered submarine in the South China Sea last month.

node.title: Only 89 NYC Cops on Leave Over Vaccine Mandate Despite Lawsuit, Union Opposition
node.description: "But when you take into account our size, that's .25 of one percent," NYPD Commissioner Dermot Shea said in response to the 89 officers placed on unpaid leave.

node.title: Texas Leads U.S. in Uncounted From 2020 Census With 377K, Simulation Shows
node.description: The size of the Texas' simulated undercount could have repercussions, including missing out on $247 million in 2021 federal Medicaid reimbursements.

node.title: University of Florida Under Review After Refusing to Let 3 Professors Testify in Court
node.description: The school previously said that the testimony would go against the school's interest and relationship with Gov. Ron DeSantis.

node.title: Ethiopia leader asks citizens to defend government as rebels advance
node.description: Weeks after declaring that his army would soon quash rebels in the Tigray province, Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed tells citizens "dying for Ethiopia is a duty for all," as a war he's accused of starting creeps toward his doorstep.

node.title: How Blue and Red States Deal With Covid
node.description: About a Ross Douthat column suggesting that liberal states are being too stringent and should move toward normalcy. Also: Women and finances; aging prisoners.

node.title: Facing Elimination, the Houston Astros Find Their Bats
node.description: A first-inning grand slam had Atlanta thinking championship, but the Astros kept fighting and sent the Series back to Houston for Game 6.

node.title: Why Do Egyptians Love Liver? This Queens Food Cart Has One Answer.
node.description: Foda Egyptian Sandwiches, in Astoria, specializes in a delicacy that has spread from its native Alexandria to cities all over that country.

node.title: Where and how to vote in New York City.
node.description: How to find your polling place — and a quick rundown of what’s on the ballot.

node.title: The billions set aside in Glasgow to save forests represent a fraction of spending to support fossil fuels.
node.description: As the world stares down the barrel of climate catastrophe and a worsening biodiversity crisis, the forests that are remain are crucial.

node.title: Biden pledged $3 billion to help the world adapt to climate change. That’s not as much as it seems.
node.description: The amount is half as much as what was recently proposed for a six-mile sea wall to protect Miami from the Atlantic Ocean.

node.title: Here are the charges in the Rittenhouse trial.
node.description: Kyle Rittenhouse is charged with six counts, including first-degree intentional homicide.

node.title: Man Finds 'Secret Room' Boarded Up in His Apartment With Windows
node.description: The college student found a set of stairs leading to an attic room, with windows, behind a fake wall in his pantry.

node.title: Police Funding Among Largest Issues Facing Voters in Mayoral Elections Across U.S.
node.description: Questions about when and where police officers are needed, and if they are needed at all, began to unfold during 2020 after George Floyd was killed.

node.title: Dozens Killed in Attack on Military Hospital in Afghanistan’s Capital
node.description: No group has claimed responsibility for the violence, but the Islamic State has struck more often since the fall of the U.S.-backed government in August.

node.title: What’s at stake? Is it too late to register to vote? Making sense of Election Day.
node.description: Just because it’s an odd-numbered year doesn’t mean that Tuesday’s elections are lacking drama. Here’s a guide to where and how you can vote.

node.title: The judge presiding over the case has been ‘in this business for 50 years.’
node.description: Judge Bruce Schroeder's longevity is a subject of frequent conversation in the courtroom.

node.title: The Rose Queen of Texas
node.description: In the rose capital of the United States, a tradition wrenched off track by the pandemic is back and in full bloom.

node.title: U.K. Apologizes to Israeli Minister Who Missed COP26 Over Wheelchair Access
node.description: Both the U.K. minister for the Middle East and North Africa and the U.K.'s ambassador to Israel have apologized formally to Karine Elharrar-Hartstein.

node.title: Boston, Virginia Will Make History Tonight, Electing First Women of Color to Top Roles
node.description: Virginia is expected to elect a woman of color to be lieutenant governor, while Boston will do the same for its incoming mayor.

node.title: France Accuses Australia of Lying About Sub Deal, Says Aussies Have 'Yet to Apologize'
node.description: French President Emmanuel Macron said this week that the nuclear submarine deal was "very bad news for the credibility of Australia."

node.title: Kristy Swanson, actress and vaccine skeptic, is hospitalized with Covid.
node.description: The actress, who played the titular character in the 1992 film “Buffy the Vampire Slayer,” said she had pneumonia.

node.title: How Fentanyl and Meth Took Over America
node.description: “The Least of Us,” by Sam Quinones, applies a kaleidoscopic approach to so-called designer drugs and efforts to combat addiction.

node.title: The Mixologists Who Create ‘Liquid Adventures’ for Couples
node.description: Josh Rosenthal, who with his wife runs Los Angeles-based Grand Bevy Corporation, says that these days the wedding cocktail is more than just a drink.

node.title: Drugmakers Handed First Win Out of Thousands of National Opioid Crisis Lawsuits
node.description: Over 3,300 lawsuits have been filed across the U.S. over an opioid epidemic that led to nearly 500,000 overdose deaths between 1999 and 2019.

node.title: Kabul Military Hospital Attacked for Second Time in Five Years, Leaving Over a Dozen Dead
node.description: The assault began with a suicide bombing at the front entrance, followed by gunmen swarming into the building.

node.title: Medicare Expansion, Free College Among Voters' Top Priorities, But Cut From Biden's Plan
node.description: Adding dental and vision benefits to Medicare was one of the most critical aspects of the original Build Back Better plan for 52 percent of voters surveyed.

node.title: Climate change's impact on crops could be felt as early as 2030
node.description: By the end of the century, corn crop yields could are projected to decrease by 24% under a high greenhouse gas emissions scenario — a decline that could have "severe implications worldwide."

node.title: Police officers admit sharing photos of murdered sisters online
node.description: Bibaa Henry and Nicole Smallman were found dead in bushes in Fryent Country Park in Wembley Park, northwest London, last year.

node.title: "Indians" sign removed as MLB team starts rebranding
node.description: The team's rebranding hit a snag last week when a roller derby team accused them of stealing their name.

node.title: CDC advisers to vote on Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine for kids 5 to 11
node.description: The CDC director will have the final word on whether to allow use of the shots for younger children.

node.title: Kristy Swanson, Actress and Vaccine Skeptic, Is Hospitalized With Covid
node.description: The actress, who played the titular character in the 1992 film “Buffy the Vampire Slayer,” said she had pneumonia.

node.title: Opioid Makers Win Major Victory in California Trial
node.description: In one of the first cases to be brought against drug manufacturers over the crisis, a judge ruled that there was “simply no evidence” the companies were liable in the epidemic.

node.title: (Very) Adult Animation About Mixed-Up Kids
node.description: In a rising tide of animated series, Netflix’s “Big Mouth,” Funimation’s “Sonny Boy” and HBO Max’s “Ten Year Old Tom” are worth catching.

node.title: How Car Shortages Are Putting the World’s Economy at Risk
node.description: Because so many jobs depend on automaking, the industry’s production problems are causing the pain to ripple.

node.title: Election Day 2021 Live Updates: Polls Open For Virginia, New Jersey Governor Races
node.description: The governor's race in Virginia could indicate where the country stands heading into the 2022 midterm elections. Follow Newsweek's liveblog for all the latest.

node.title: How saving soggy peat bogs can help fight climate change
node.description: Spongy, decaying vegetation around the world has safely stored carbon dioxide for centuries, but it's losing ground. But the real value of the sodden peat is finally being recognized.

node.title: Yahoo Ends Service in China Due to 'Challenging' Environment
node.description: Having slowly wound down its services over the past decade, Yahoo officially left the Chinese market on Sunday.

node.title: As Demand for Green Energy Grows, Solar Farms Face Local Resistance
node.description: Developers say industrial-scale farms are needed to meet the nation’s climate goals, but locals are fighting back against what they see as an encroachment on their pastoral settings.

node.title: Kaepernick compares treatment of players at NFL combine to slavery
node.description: Kaepernick described how pro hopefuls are treated at the combine, where prospects undergo physical and mental tests in front of team coaches and executives.

node.title: Division led Biden officials to embrace Trump-era border policies
node.description: Infighting between those who support tougher enforcement and those who favor expanding access to the asylum system has hindered the administration's border policy, officials told CBS News.

node.title: The Unequal Toll of Covid-19 in California
node.description: During Día de Muertos, or Day of the Dead, we remember those who have been lost.

node.title: Elon Musk says Tesla has not signed a deal with Hertz yet.
node.description: Hertz had said that it would convert more than 20 percent of its rental fleet to Tesla’s cars, a deal that helped propel Tesla’s stock value beyond $1 trillion for the first time.

node.title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
node.description: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.

node.title: What’s Emerging From the Melting Ice?
node.description: As global temperatures rise, permafrost and glaciers are rapidly thawing and eroding, releasing ancient animal remains and human artifacts.

node.title: How Esperanza Spalding and Wayne Shorter Realized His Dream: an Opera
node.description: “Iphigenia,” an update of the ancient Greek myth eight years in the making and decades in the dreaming, will begin a run of performances this month.

node.title: NASA's SpaceX Crew-3 Launch Date Changed Again After Astronaut's 'Medical Issue'
node.description: The mission marks the first ever spaceflight for three of the crew members who will be onboard the ISS-bound Crew Dragon spacecraft.

node.title: More same-sex couples may be eligible for Social Security survivor benefits.
node.description: Even after winning the right to marry across the U.S. more than six years ago, some same-sex couples have faced challenges accessing certain benefits.

node.title: New blood test can spot more than 50 types of cancer
node.description: Many of them are hard to detect early. One doctor calls the test "a game changer."

node.title: Yahoo to exit China, citing commitment to "open" internet
node.description: Internet platform says it will end services in People's Republic because of the "challenging business and legal" environment.

node.title: Huma Abedin on overcoming her husband Anthony Weiner's betrayals
node.description: In her first TV interview, the longtime aide to Hillary Clinton talks about weathering public scandal as the wife of disgraced former Congressman Anthony Weiner, and opens up about how her anger over his sexting transgressions "almost killed me."

node.title: GOP looks for upset in New Jersey governor's race as Democrats hope to buck history
node.description: The Garden State has been reliably blue in presidential and U.S. Senate elections, but an incumbent Democrat hasn't been reelected since 1977.

node.title: Oklahoma Pardon and Parole Board recommends clemency for Julius Jones
node.description: The final decision rests in the hands of Oklahoma Governor Kevin Stitt.

node.title: New York’s 5 ballot measures include proposals to make voting easier.
node.description: The ballot proposals also involve changes to civil courts, legislative redistricting and environmental rights.

node.title: Dog's Hilarious Reaction to Owner Being 'Attacked' by Vacuum Cleaner Viewed 53M Times
node.description: The dog's unfazed response led TikTok users to wonder what might have been going through its mind.

node.title: Video of Virginia Man Unsure About Critical Race Theory Watched 3.5M Times
node.description: The man said CRT was the most important issue in Virginia's governor race, but didn't want to "get into the specifics" as he doesn't "understand it that much."

node.title: Election Day 2021: Virginia race in spotlight as voters across U.S. head to polls
node.description: Voters in Virginia and New Jersey will be choosing governors, and there are closely-watched contests in New York City, Buffalo and Minneapolis.

node.title: Innovative program helps kids overcome their fear of needles
node.description: An estimated 63% of children are afraid of needles but technology is helping families reduce fear and anxiety.

node.title: What's behind the push for a fourth stimulus check
node.description: IRS has distributed almost 170 million payments. But hardship remains widespread as the Delta variant spreads.

node.title: Ecuador says it will extend protections around the Galápagos Islands.
node.description: President Guillermo Lasso said his government had agreed with Ecuador’s fishery, tourism and conservation sectors to establish a marine reserve of more than 23,000 square miles.

node.title: The ‘Jaws’ Shoot Was a Drama. Now It’s a Play.
node.description: The hit movie’s set was plagued by malfunctioning sharks and drunken feuds — perfect material for a night at the theater.

node.title: Internet Backs Man Evicting His Girlfriend After She Kicked His Cat Out
node.description: The man claimed he dumped his girlfriend of two years after she booted his indoor cat out, claiming his pet "could have died."

node.title: Alien Life Could Be Found on Mars Thanks to NASA Curiosity Rover's New Trick
node.description: Following years of analysis, the results of experiments conducted by the rover's SAM instrument, which searched for the building blocks of life on Mars, are in.

node.title: Huma Abedin on how Hillary Clinton weathered the Lewinsky scandal
node.description: After 25 years in the background, Abedin is now sharing what it was like to be with Clinton when the Lewinsky affair became public.
